title: Suxamethonium induced prolonged apnea in a patient receiving electroconvulsive therapy.
abst: Suxamethonium causes prolonged apnea in patients in whom pseudocholinesterase enzyme gets deactivated by organophosphorus (OP) poisons. Here, we present a similar incident in a severely depressed patient who received electroconvulsive therapy (ECT). Prolonged apnea in our case ensued because the information about suicidal attempt by OP compound was concealed from the treating team.
title_plus_abst: Suxamethonium induced prolonged apnea in a patient receiving electroconvulsive therapy. Suxamethonium causes prolonged apnea in patients in whom pseudocholinesterase enzyme gets deactivated by organophosphorus (OP) poisons. Here, we present a similar incident in a severely depressed patient who received electroconvulsive therapy (ECT). Prolonged apnea in our case ensued because the information about suicidal attempt by OP compound was concealed from the treating team.
split_sentence: Suxamethonium induced prolonged apnea in a patient receiving electroconvulsive therapy.
Suxamethonium causes prolonged apnea in patients in whom pseudocholinesterase enzyme gets deactivated by organophosphorus (OP) poisons.
Here, we present a similar incident in a severely depressed patient who received electroconvulsive therapy (ECT).
Prolonged apnea in our case ensued because the information about suicidal attempt by OP compound was concealed from the treating team.
